title: SB 1.18.44-45 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 26-04-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Due to the termination of the monarchical regimes and the plundering of the people's wealth by rogues and thieves, there will be great social disruptions.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces verse 44, explaining how the absence of a strong monarchical regime leads to social disruption, plundering, and a general decline in safety and security.

segments.key_quote: Nowadays there is no value for human life. Especially if the person who dies is a most ordinary citizen. Nobody cares.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the consequences of Kali Yuga, highlighting the lack of value for human life, the exploitation of women, and the general degradation of society.

segments.key_quote: In a cultured society, five categories of people are offered protection. Brahmanas, women, children, old people and cows.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts a cultured society with the current degraded state, emphasizing the lack of protection for vulnerable groups and criticizing the democratic system as a means for plunderers to exploit the state's wealth.

segments.key_quote: And thus, instead of one king, a number of irresponsible kings grow up to tax the citizens.
segments.summary: The speaker continues to critique the democratic system, arguing that it leads to irresponsible rulers who prioritize personal gratification and burden citizens with excessive taxes, causing disturbance and plundering.

segments.key_quote: At that time, the people in general, will fall systematically, from a path of a progressive civilization...there will be an unwanted population, on the level of dogs and monkeys.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces verse 45, explaining how the decline in Vedic principles leads to a degraded civilization and an unwanted population characterized by animalistic tendencies.

segments.key_quote: The Vedic way of life is a progressive march, of the civilization of Aryans...they always have the goal of going back home, back to Godhead.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of good progeny and the Vedic way of life for spiritual progress, contrasting it with the degradation and unfortunate situation of Kali Yuga, where people are losing the opportunity for eternal happiness and knowledge.
